Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_register_EOF_callback

The function AIL_register_EOF_callback arranges for callback service to be provided to an application function immediately upon reaching the end of a file whose handle was allocated by AIL_allocate_file_sample.

AILSAMPLECB AIL_register_EOF_callback(
  HSAMPLE S,
  AILSAMPLECB EOFILE
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample for which end-of-file (EOF) callback service is desired.
EOFILE
should be set to the address of the callback function which is to be invoked just after the last audio sample in a file is merged into the hardware buffer for playback. A value of NULL cancels end-of-file callbacks.

Returns

The address of the previously-installed EOF callback function handler.

Discussion

The sample handle will be released by the MSS system as soon as the EOF callback function returns, so it is not necessary to set up an EOF callback handler for this purpose.

See AIL_allocate_file_sample for further information on memory-resident .VOC and .WAV file playback.

Most MSS functions can be safely invoked from within callback functions. Exceptions include driver-installation or driver-shutdown functions and any other functions which may perform DOS or BIOS calls, such as AIL_init_sequence. These exceptions are noted in the descriptions of the functions involved. If in doubt about whether a particular action may safely be performed from within a timer callback function, contact RAD Game Tools for assistance.


Group: 2D Digital Audio Services
Related Functions: AILSAMPLECB, AIL_allocate_file_sample, AIL_init_sequence, AIL_register_EOB_callback, AIL_register_EOS_callback, AIL_register_SOB_callback
Related Basic Types: HSAMPLE
Related FAQs: What's the deal with callbacks - are they threads, interrupts, system timers, or what?
